metadata.title: CVE-2021-32029 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: A flaw was found in postgresql. Using an UPDATE ... RETURNING command on apurpose-crafted table, an authenticated database user could read arbitrarybytes of server memory. The highest threat from this vulnerability is todata confidentiality.

criterions.comment: postgresql-9.5: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
